The sad part is that some day all of us will die. It can be in 2080, in 2100 or who knows it maybe could be in 2120, but then anybody will remember this wonderful game. I can think in myself reading this comments in 2060 being all of us old mans.

Yes... there are alot of great games... but for some reason Golden Sun was different... I think the main part was, becuz its good suited music along the area or event that was going on... that made this game the best of best!

I still enjoy watching/playing this even in this year 2016! LIKE of you agree!

snippet.textDisplay: What I remember most from Golden Sun as a kid is the feeling that I actually messed up (when you get the stars and such) and you couldn't go back home till you got them. The story was more engaging in a way, unlike some FF stories like "I fell into a hole and I'm the choosen one now", "Look at us four, where the choosen ones! The crystal said it! Again!"
snippet.textOriginal: What I remember most from Golden Sun as a kid is the feeling that I actually messed up (when you get the stars and such) and you couldn't go back home till you got them. The story was more engaging in a way, unlike some FF stories like "I fell into a hole and I'm the choosen one now", "Look at us four, where the choosen ones! The crystal said it! Again!"

snippet.textDisplay: Golden Sun had a great original fantasy setting. Much better than old Final Fantasy and the more modern ones that you can't even wrap your head around that.

snippet.textDisplay: +gamerprince1999 Well for me, I find it SOUNDS INCREDIABLE! For the GBA soundchip which I find sounds like ASS with SNES or WORSE WITH GENESIS CONVERTING! I can appreciate the music here ALLOT more!
snippet.textOriginal: +gamerprince1999 Well for me, I find it SOUNDS INCREDIABLE! For the GBA soundchip which I find sounds like ASS with SNES or WORSE WITH GENESIS CONVERTING! I can appreciate the music here ALLOT more!

snippet.textDisplay: THIS IS PLAYING ON A GBA SOUND CHIP?
snippet.textOriginal: THIS IS PLAYING ON A GBA SOUND CHIP?

snippet.textDisplay: +Abus Bambus Except the GBA doesn't hava a sound chip. It retains the GBC sound processor but everything else is made by the main CPU itself :). It's quite an hybrid system, so everything depends on how much CPU time and ROM space (for the samples) the developers wanted to reserve for the sound.
snippet.textOriginal: +Abus Bambus Except the GBA doesn't hava a sound chip. It retains the GBC sound processor but everything else is made by the main CPU itself :). It's quite an hybrid system, so everything depends on how much CPU time and ROM space (for the samples) the developers wanted to reserve for the sound.

snippet.textDisplay: @Atstyle Except there was rather little else to explore but your next destination, since you were going to the places you just explored anyway. You couldn't work around the point of return after the Eclipse either, which was Port Rago,Te Ryu, Kolima Forest, the Bilibin Gate, and etc. If Dark Dawn had more exploration than another game, I won't waste my time playing it because imo, there was very little exploring. What was the point of putting Iris in the game if you couldn't use her?
snippet.textOriginal: @Atstyle Except there was rather little else to explore but your next destination, since you were going to the places you just explored anyway. What was the point of putting Iris in the game if you couldn't use her?

snippet.textDisplay: @XfishX well thats a bit too much here. it's your responsability to take your time and explore, which I did in this game as much as in the other ones. as soon as they tell me to go somewhere i do the opposite and explore every places except the "next destination". dark dawn had more explorinf than broken seal but a bit lesser than lost age. and yes the point of no return were not that bad xcept for the 1st one that can't be worked around.

snippet.textDisplay: @malkav616 The new game is... both good and bad. It isn't horrible, but it doesn't compare to Golden Sun and The Lost Age by any means. Considering they had almost 10 years between the games, the new one should have been blow-your-mind amazing, but it wasn't. The biggest issues with me in the game were that there's points of no return, and you get relatively little exploring time; the game tells you where to go next instead of letting you figure it out... I'd still recommend it to anyone though.
snippet.textOriginal: @malkav616 The new game is... both good and bad. It isn't horrible, but it doesn't compare to Golden Sun and The Lost Age by any means. Considering they had almost 10 years between the games, the new one should have been blow-your-mind amazing, but it wasn't. The biggest issues with me in the game were that there's points of no return, and you get relatively little exploring time; the game tells you where to go next instead of letting you figure it out... I'd still recommend it to anyone though.

snippet.textDisplay: @lightignakelloyd I don't think anyone likes sitting in the same battle for over 10+ minutes doing the same command over and over again drawing magic. Squall's turn, Draw, Stock Cure. Do that over and over and over until you have 100 Cures. Squall's turn, Draw, Stock Thunder. Do that over and over and over again until you have 100 Thunders. That's not some opinion, it's a fact. No one liked that. No one has ever liked that. No one ever will. It ruined the game completely.
snippet.textOriginal: @lightignakelloyd I don't think anyone likes sitting in the same battle for over 10+ minutes doing the same command over and over again drawing magic. Squall's turn, Draw, Stock Cure. Do that over and over and over until you have 100 Cures. Squall's turn, Draw, Stock Thunder. Do that over and over and over again until you have 100 Thunders. That's not some opinion, it's a fact. No one liked that. No one has ever liked that. No one ever will. It ruined the game completely.

snippet.textDisplay: @lightignakelloyd The main meaning, what it's intended to be on paper, and what it actually is/how it actually works, in practice, are two completely different things. It was a new and cool idea on paper and was intended to make managing your characters and magic/summons easier and different, but in practice, it was a total fail and completely ruined the game in every single way.
snippet.textOriginal: @lightignakelloyd The main meaning, what it's intended to be on paper, and what it actually is/how it actually works, in practice, are two completely different things. It was a new and cool idea on paper and was intended to make managing your characters and magic/summons easier and different, but in practice, it was a total fail and completely ruined the game in every single way.

snippet.textDisplay: @genesisSOC i grabbed the main meaning of the system, linking yourself to a spiritual being in order to become stronger
snippet.textOriginal: @genesisSOC i grabbed the main meaning of the system, linking yourself to a spiritual being in order to become stronger

snippet.textDisplay: @lightignakelloyd In FF8, you had to spend hours and hours and hours drawing and stocking magic from each and every enemy, never to use it, but only to put it onto your stats. In Golden Sun, you just put the same elemental Djinn you found onto their respected character and learned new magic as you naturally leveled up, without having to spend hour drawing and stocking it from every monster, and could use it freely like in any other, good and proper, RPG. That is far from similar in every aspect.
snippet.textOriginal: @lightignakelloyd In FF8, you had to spend hours and hours and hours drawing and stocking magic from each and every enemy, never to use it, but only to put it onto your stats. In Golden Sun, you just put the same elemental Djinn you found onto their respected character and learned new magic as you naturally leveled up, without having to spend hour drawing and stocking it from every monster, and could use it freely like in any other, good and proper, RPG. That is far from similar in every aspect.

snippet.textDisplay: @genesisSOC how can FF8 be bad because of the junction system if Golden Sun djinn' system is so similar to it?? c'mon, i'm not saying they're one of a kind, but they're very similar, IMHO

snippet.textDisplay: @Reinko96 What makes Golden Sun the game that it is was not just the gameplay but the compelling story, the addittion of the simple styled RPG gameplay makes a succesful formula for them to use, and besides most games continue to be played because of this, for instance: Final Fantasy. If they change the gameplay, the franchise itself might topple over and die. Seiken Densetsu fell, it's not quite dead yet though. I feel that if Camalot had changed it too much, they likely would have lost fans.
snippet.textOriginal: @Reinko96 What makes Golden Sun the game that it is was not just the gameplay but the compelling story, the addittion of the simple styled RPG gameplay makes a succesful formula for them to use, and besides most games continue to be played because of this, for instance: Final Fantasy. snippet.textDisplay: @lenethvalkyrie Actually FF8 was kinda' bad 'cause of the junction system, but I absolutely loved the story and plot. 9 was fantastic, definitely the third best of the entire series. 10 was actually really really good, while linear, it was still better than 2, 5, and 8. 10-2 yeah, I agree, terrible. 11 is actually really awesome (better than WoW IMO) but, well, even though it has a great story, it's an MMO not an FF. 12 should've been a spinoff with the Tactics series.
snippet.textOriginal: @lenethvalkyrie Actually FF8 was kinda' bad 'cause of the junction system, but I absolutely loved the story and plot. 9 was fantastic, definitely the third best of the entire series. 10 was actually really really good, while linear, it was still better than 2, 5, and 8. 10-2 yeah, I agree, terrible. 11 is actually really awesome (better than WoW IMO) but, well, even though it has a great story, it's an MMO not an FF. 12 should've been a spinoff with the Tactics series.

snippet.textDisplay:
@PleaseDieQuietly I absolutely love Golden Sun. I got it as soon as it came out and I played it from glorious start to oh so satisfying ending.

That being said, no. Golden Sun does not compare to Final Fantasy. Golden Sun is not better than Omnislashing Sephiroth, Kefka destroying the world, or Kuja casting Ultima. Golden Sun, however, is better than Lost Odyssey or Fable. By far. Golden Sun is definitely a great game. But sadly, not as good as my personal favorite top 10.
snippet.textOriginal:
@PleaseDieQuietly I absolutely love Golden Sun. I got it as soon as it came out and I played it from glorious start to oh so satisfying ending.

That being said, no. Golden Sun does not compare to Final Fantasy. Golden Sun is not better than Omnislashing Sephiroth, Kefka destroying the world, or Kuja casting Ultima. Golden Sun, however, is better than Lost Odyssey or Fable. By far. Golden Sun is definitely a great game. But sadly, not as good as my personal favorite top 10.
